label: React.js
description: An open-source, front end, JS library maintained by Facebook, used for building user interfaces or UI components. It can serve as a base in the development of single-page or mobile applications.

label: Next.js
description: Next.js is an open-source web development framework created by Vercel enabling React-based web applications with server-side rendering and generating static websites.

label: Node.js
description: A back-end runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside a web browser. It is synchronous and event-driven, designed to build scalable network applications.

label: Express.js
description: Express is a fast, unopinionated, minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features for web and mobile applications.

label: TypeScript
description: A programming language developed and maintained by Microsoft. It is a strict syntactical superset of JavaScript and adds optional static typing to the language.

label: JavaScript
description: A programming language that conforms to ECMAScript and one of the core web-technologies. It is high-level, JIT-compiled with dynamic typing and first-class functions.

label: Python
description: A high-level, general-purpose programming language that is dynamically typed and garbage-collected. It uses significant indentation with emphasis on code readability.

label: Azure
description: A cloud computing platform operated by Microsoft that provides access, management, and development of applications and services via around the world-distributed data centers.
